name: Clancys of Glenfarne

reviews.text: having returned from a trip to glenfarne, staying in Clancys b/b myself&family from glasgow,also family from australia. we had a wonderful time. Clancys b/b was very clean, the rooms were clean with u/s facilities. tea's maker, hair dryer, tv, and internet connection.
reviews.title: Clancys of glenfarne, sep 2011

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: breakfast was very good, what pleased us was the bread made fresh every morning. the staff were very pleasant, my family were delighted with standard provided.
reviews.title: Loved it and we'll be back

reviews.text: if you like walking, there are lots of places to explore. if you want a drink in a pub, you just have to cross the road. where you will meet the local's, and joine in the ''krack''[ talk]
reviews.title: The only place to stay in Co. Leitrim

reviews.text: teresa McClement
reviews.title: We loved it so much, highly recommend this b &b, definitely be back, It made our weekend.

reviews.text: When we arrived at Clancy's we were shown to our room straight away. The room was large and very clean, with tea & coffee facilities and tv, all you could need.
reviews.title: A nice quiet stay - hope to get back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the staff exceptionally friendly in every way. We were using Clancys as a base for visiting MacNean Bistro in Blacklion. We had tried to book a room in MacNean but it was booked out. I am glad that this was the case now, as we absolutely loved Clancys. The price of the rooms was very reasonable. Much cheaper than a hotel, and more homely too. Breakfast is served till noon, so there is no major hustle to get out of bed in the morning. The rooms were homely, and the staff so friendly, especially for the breakfast and the dinner service. The breakfast was a little on the dry side - rashers hard and sausages a bit small, but the staff more than made up for it. It says a lot when you are handed a newspaper by your server. We enjoyed MacNeans and were given a lift up and back by the owners of Clancys ! That was wonderful service. Another thing we loved was that Clancys was on the road to Sligo, close to Enniskillen, and very close to the Marble Arch Caves and Florencecourt Gardens. If you are staying in Clancys, you should head over to McHughs pub across the road, and make sure to head for the bar. The locals are a scream, and the beer is lovely. Overall we really enjoyed our stay, and we will be back again in August for a longer visit.
reviews.title: We absolutely loved Clancys

reviews.text: We stopped off here on the road home from Sligo for Sunday dinner, the food was amazing wholesome home cooked dinners which u where given plenty of and was very well priced,all our family loved it, the service was great and even though there was eight of us the food arrived quickly and all together, an amazing little place x
reviews.title: Food

reviews.text: Stayed at Clancy's for several nights visiting family near Glenfarne. This place is a jewel in the rough. Jim and Asumpta were the most gracious hosts making us feel like family. The rooms were clean and the meals were good home cooked meals and the "homemade brown bread is to die for" This place is a great spot to stay if you are in the area.
reviews.title: loved everything about it

reviews.text: Spent a few nights with the family at Clancy's.
reviews.title: You are treated like a VIP.

reviews.text: Does not matter when you wake up, Breakfast is served whenever you want.
reviews.title: Great as usual

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a one night stay in Clancy's and would highly recommend it, it is a very quiet area but we were there to dine in McNean restaurant so it was exactly what suited us, we arrived, were shown to our room straight away, room was large and spotless with everything you would require for an overnight stay, I loved the Dove toiletries. We availed of complimentary transport to and from restaurant and had an excellant, FRESHLY cooked breakfast in the morning, when WE were ready to eat, no pressure to have breakfast before a certain time. The only thing that I would change if I had to pick one thing to change, would be a flat screen television in the room. Good Service & great hospitality.
reviews.title: Home away from Home

reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights recently. Everything was first rate and the staff were amazing. There is a good buzz around the place and my room was extremely comfortable. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Very comfortable and friendly place to stay in Leitrim

reviews.text: Very good location because by the road between Northern Ireland and western part of Republic of Ireland. Large park place opposite to the hotel, very nice vicinity.
reviews.title: comfortable, good location

reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic Guesthouse! Rooms are spacious with incredibly comfortable beds. Breakfasts (complete with traditional boxty) are exactly what you need to fuel you for the day. They even provided free transport to AND from our restaurant! McHugh's pub is only a few steps from Clancys so a fine 'before & after' dinner drink is only the width of a road away. We couldn't rate Clancys of Glenfarne highly enough!
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic Guesthouse! Rooms...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first experience with a guest-house sized establishment. Large hotels are (needfully) very hussle-bussle; and residential home B&B's can make you feel a little too intimate with your host - (like you're imposing on aunt Gertrude); but Clancy's of Glenfarne was Just Right. Clancy's has a clean, cozy, relaxed atmosphere like the surrounding countryside where his guesthouse is located. We also enjoyed using his restaurant (best boxty we ever ate), grocery market, and post office, all conveniently located under the same roof with his inn accomodations. The local country pub is just a walk across the road, but the two buildings are spaced far enough apart that any late-night revelries at the pub are of no disturbance to Clancy's guests.
reviews.title: Just Right - not too big, not too intimate; and very personalized service for our unique needs on this trip.

reviews.text: My mother, daughter and visited the Mc nean Bistro and stayed at Clancys of Glenfarne. The rooms were really clean and comofortable and the setting beautiful. The staff especailly Geraldine were ever so welcoming and friendly. Our meal at Mc Neans was amazing but our breakfast at Clancys the next morning was top notch and as the restaurant is also open to the public we were part of the goings on in a rural village for a while too.
reviews.title: A really good Guesthouse Experience

reviews.text: Had a great stay as a party of 8, very friendly service, breakfast was very tasty, rooms were clean and comfortable, staff were very accommodating to us. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: A great B&B

reviews.text: We were a party of 3 adults and 2 children visiting family in the area. We stayed at Clancy's for 3 nights and used the restaurant in the evening on 2 occasions.The service was exceptional, the staff friendly and welcoming and the varied menu (for breakfast and evening meals) was delicious and had something for everyone in our party. This was our second time staying at Clancy's and we would not hesitate to return again!
reviews.title: Excellent accommodation, service and food

reviews.text: Just back from a one night bike trip to Leitrim. Stayed at Clancys of Glenfarne. Its been a year and half since i last called there and its been all done up, well done to the designer. Can't fault the place, clean, good banter from the the staff. showers and bath room excellent. The restaurant now stays open tilll late, had a very nice steak at 8pm which was washed down across the road. The owner put or bikes into locked garage overnight too.
reviews.title: Clancys Updated!

reviews.text: Take a bow Clancy's
reviews.title: Lovely

description: Our Guest House accommodation consists of 8 tastefully decorated en suite bedrooms, all with television, telephone, tea/coffee and free broadband internet access. Satellite channels available. A two bedroom apartment is also available and this provides ideal accommodation for families.We present a perfect base for exploring this undiscovered part of the country and special discounts are available for groups. Children's discount is also available when sharing with adults.
